Key Arguments: The legislation could lead to an Orwellian and dystopian society where the government and corporations control truth.
Historical examples like Galileo and Socrates show the dangers of suppressing ideas and speech.
The government should not determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Individuals should have the freedom to discern truth from fiction as a basic human right.
The legislation sets a dangerous precedent that threatens principles and morality.
Notable Quotes: If this legislation passes... we as a country and a global society are driving ourselves closer to an Orwellian and dystopian world where government and corporations decide what is true and what is false.
Everyone should be free to decide what is true and discern fact from fiction. That is no more than a basic human right.
Good intentions or not, we cannot in good conscience allow a law like this to pass.
